Pre-Game Insights: Denmark is preparing for Euro 2024 and will compete in Group C against Slovenia, Serbia, and England.
Sweden missed out on a spot at the Euros and will look to disrupt Denmark’s preparations.
Sweden's new manager, Jon Dahl Tomasson, is the first-ever non-Swede to take charge of the team.
Rasmus Hojlund and Alexander Isak are highlighted as key players to watch.
Denmark has been in good form with a record of W-D-L-W-W in their last five matches.
Sweden has been inconsistent with a record of W-L-W-W-L in their last five matches.
Betting tips favor Denmark to win, with odds of 1.90 for a Denmark win, 3.40 for a draw, and 3.85 for a Sweden win.
The most common result of matches between Denmark and Sweden is 1-0, with three matches ending with this result.
Denmark scores an average of 2 goals at home, while Sweden scores an average of 1.6 goals away.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be held at Parken Stadium.
Kick-off times are 10:30 PM (IST), 05:00 PM (GMT), and 12:30 PM (EST).
The match will be telecasted on Sony Sports Network and Sony Liv in India, Premier Sports 2 in the UK, and ESPN and FOX Sports in the USA.
Denmark has no injury concerns, while Victor Gyokeres is out due to injury for Sweden.
Head-to-head record: Denmark has won 41 matches, Sweden has won 46 matches, and there have been 20 draws in their 107 encounters.
